verses.verse: To the chief Musician <S%H5329><s%> <S%H8764><s%> upon Gittith <S%H1665><s%>, A Psalm of Asaph <S%H623><s%>. Sing aloud <S%H7442><s%> <S%H8685><s%> unto 'Elohim <S%H430><s%> our strength <S%H5797><s%>: make a joyful noise <S%H7321><s%> <S%H8685><s%> unto the 'Elohim <S%H430><s%> of Ya`akov <S%H3290><s%>.

Take <S%H5375><s%> <S%H8798><s%> a psalm <S%H2172><s%>, and bring <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8798><s%> hither the timbrel <S%H8596><s%>, the pleasant <S%H5273><s%> harp <S%H3658><s%> with the psaltery <S%H5035><s%>.
Blow up <S%H8628><s%> <S%H8798><s%> the shofar <S%H7782><s%> in the new moon <S%H2320><s%>, in the time appointed <S%H3677><s%>, on our solemn feast <S%H2282><s%> day <S%H3117><s%>.
For this was a statute <S%H2706><s%> for Yisra'EL <S%H3478><s%>, and a Torah <S%H4941><s%> of the 'Elohim <S%H430><s%> of Ya`akov <S%H3290><s%>.

This he ordained <S%H7760><s%> <S%H8804><s%> in Yosef <S%H3084><s%> for a testimony <S%H5715><s%>, when he went out <S%H3318><s%> <S%H8800><s%> through the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>: where I heard <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8799><s%> a language <S%H8193><s%> that I understood <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8804><s%> not.
I removed <S%H5493><s%> <S%H8689><s%> his shoulder <S%H7926><s%> from the burden <S%H5447><s%>: his hands <S%H3709><s%> were delivered <S%H5674><s%> <S%H8799><s%> from the pots <S%H1731><s%>.

Thou calledst <S%H7121><s%> <S%H8804><s%> in trouble <S%H6869><s%>, and I delivered <S%H2502><s%> <S%H8762><s%> thee; I answered <S%H6030><s%> <S%H8799><s%> thee in the secret place <S%H5643><s%> of thunder <S%H7482><s%>: I proved <S%H974><s%> <S%H8799><s%> thee at the waters <S%H4325><s%> of Meribah <S%H4809><s%>. Selah <S%H5542><s%>.

Hear <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8798><s%>, O my people <S%H5971><s%>, and I will testify <S%H5749><s%> <S%H8686><s%> unto thee: O Yisra'EL <S%H3478><s%>, if thou wilt hearken <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8799><s%> unto me;
There shall no strange <S%H2114><s%> <S%H8801><s%> god <S%H410><s%> be in thee; neither shalt thou worship <S%H7812><s%> <S%H8691><s%> any strange <S%H5236><s%> god <S%H410><s%>.

I am the YY <S%H3068><s%> thy 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>, which brought <S%H5927><s%> <S%H8688><s%> thee out of the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>: open thy mouth <S%H6310><s%> wide <S%H7337><s%> <S%H8685><s%>, and I will fill <S%H4390><s%> <S%H8762><s%> it.
But my people <S%H5971><s%> would not hearken <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8804><s%> to my voice <S%H6963><s%>; and Yisra'EL <S%H3478><s%> would <S%H14><s%> <S%H8804><s%> none of me.
So I gave them up <S%H7971><s%> <S%H8762><s%> unto their own hearts <S%H3820><s%> ' lust <S%H8307><s%>: and they walked <S%H3212><s%> <S%H8799><s%> in their own counsels <S%H4156><s%>.
Oh <S%H3863><s%> that my people <S%H5971><s%> had hearkened <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8802><s%> unto me, and Yisra'EL <S%H3478><s%> had walked <S%H1980><s%> <S%H8762><s%> in my ways <S%H1870><s%> !

I should soon <S%H4592><s%> have subdued <S%H3665><s%> <S%H8686><s%> their enemies <S%H341><s%> <S%H8802><s%>, and turned <S%H7725><s%> <S%H8686><s%> my hand <S%H3027><s%> against their adversaries <S%H6862><s%>.

The haters <S%H8130><s%> <S%H8764><s%> of the YY <S%H3068><s%> should have submitted <S%H3584><s%> <S%H8762><s%> themselves unto him: but their time <S%H6256><s%> should have endured for ever <S%H5769><s%>.

He should have fed <S%H398><s%> <S%H8686><s%> them also with the finest <S%H2459><s%> of the wheat <S%H2406><s%>: and with honey <S%H1706><s%> out of the rock <S%H6697><s%> should I have satisfied <S%H7646><s%> <S%H8686><s%> thee.
